text:
For example, rather than attempting to measure the performance of the U.S. stock
market by observing the performance of all 10,000 or so stocks trading in the United
States at any one time, the performance of the subgroup of 500 stocks in the S&P 500
can be measured. The results of the statistical analysis of this sample can then be used to
draw conclusions about the entire population of U.S. stocks.
